message.content: {"id": "47910", "title": "ajc outjar jarfile does not contain MANIFEST.MF", "description": "When using ajc to compile Java source files and create a .jar file with the outjar option, the generated .jar file does not contain a MANIFEST.MF file. The ajc documentation suggests that the outjar option should create a zip file, but it is not clear how to include a valid MANIFEST.MF file in the output.", "OB": "When calling ajc with the sourceroots option and the outjar option to specify the output .jar file, the resulting .jar file is missing a MANIFEST.MF file.", "EB": "The ajc compiler should include a MANIFEST.MF file in the generated .jar file when using the outjar option.", "SR": "To reproduce the issue, execute the command 'ajc sourceroots <mydir outjar <my.jar' and observe that the generated .jar file does not contain a MANIFEST.MF file."}

origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '47910', 'title': 'Bug 47910ajc outjar jarfile does not contain MANIFEST.MF', 'description': 'with a METAINF/MANIFEST.MFfile inside. ', 'OB': "Bug 47910ajc outjar jarfile does not contain MANIFEST.MF I call ajc sourceroots <mydir outjar <my.jar and an output file is createdwith a .jar extension, but it is not a valid jar file because there is noMANIFEST.MF file. I see that the text for ajc says:outjar <fileput output classes in zip file <filewhich might imply that it is supposed to be a zip file, but a parameter called outjar which creates a zip file doesn't really make sense. ", 'EB': '', 'SR': 'I call ajc sourceroots <mydir outjar <my.jar and an output file is createdwith a .jar extension, but it is not a valid jar file because there is noMANIFEST.MF file. '}
